item.title: Overhanging plants danger to pedestrians, 18th August
item.description:
I don't know why I have to keep reporting this & why you don't check this regularly? Once again the plants & weeds on the railway bridge pavement which is very narrow anyway are growing through the fence onto that narrow pavement meaning pedestrians have to walk very near to busy main road ?? Please sort put & initiate some sort of regular check !
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brampton Road, Welling, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Missing paving slab outside the last entrance door in titmuss avenue, 18th August
item.description:
Good afternoon please could a missing paving slab be replaced as soon as possible as it is currently missing and is dangerous for the residents. The address is... Titmuss avenue Thamesmead London SE28 Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 60, Titmuss Avenue, Thamesmead, London

item.title: Constant lime bikes on the pavement outside my front door., 18th August
item.description:
People constantly leaving Lime bikes outside of my front door. It stops me from walking on the pavement and it is in the way of anyone who is using a pushchair or wheelchair. It’s constant and has been happening since Lime has been in London as there is a pub across the road with high traffic.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 47-55, Gowlett Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The mayor of Hackney. The metropolitan police commissioner. Safer neighbourhood police. Sergeant Terry. Inspector Muhammad. Criminal activity antisocial behavior issues need addressing by all parties. Irish traveller criminal gang stealing and cloning vehicles on a daily basis from these car parks at location. The local traveller gang are coming from homerton traveller camp/millfields travel camp/Hackney Wick area. Criminal gang operating here. Traffic police and ampr operations need to be set up in the neighborhood to tackle this crime., 18th August
